title: Covid: Are teachers more at risk of dying?
description: Labour's Angela Rayner has suggested teachers are "more at risk of infection and death" from the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Government withdraws 'sexist' Stay at Home advert
description: The advert urging people to remain indoors during lockdown showed only women doing domestic chores.

title: Paperchase rescue safeguards 1,000 jobs
description: The stationery chain is bought out of administration in a deal rescuing up to 90 of its 127 stores.

title: Coronavirus: Tory MP Sir Desmond Swayne refuses to apologise over Covid claims
description: Sir Desmond Swayne has been accused of spreading "dangerous misinformation" about coronavirus.

title: Leeds ferret survives 100 minutes in washing machine
description: Bandit the ferret was saved by vets in Leeds after suffering a collapsed lung and bruising.

title: Covid-19: Third of police officers 'threatened with deliberate infection'
description: Officers say people thought to be infected with Covid threatened to breathe or cough on them.

title: Coronavirus: Germany facing '10 tough weeks' of vaccine shortages
description: The health minister says supply issues will continue amid a row between the EU and AstraZeneca.

title: Boris Johnson to make case for united Covid response on Scotland visit
description: Boris Johnson says the pandemic shows the value of working together, amid independence vote calls.

title: Rita Ora: Venue was paid to breach Covid rules, police tell committee
description: The pop star should have been isolating at home after returning from Egypt when she threw a party.

title: GameStop: Amateur investors continue to outwit Wall Street
description: Private investors using online chatrooms have led to a trading frenzy in some unexpected shares.

title: Can you get a free laptop or cheaper broadband?
description: What help is there if you're trying to home-school your children without devices or data?

title: Covid: UK vaccine supplies 'won't be interrupted' - Gove
description: A row over vaccine shortages has seen the EU demand AstraZeneca supply it with doses from UK plants.

title: Coronavirus: Black MPs unite in video to encourage vaccine take-up
description: The video comes amid concerns black people are less likely to get the coronavirus vaccine.

title: Covid: House parties in Scarborough reported 'every night'
description: A police force says people holding parties during lockdown in Scarborough were "plain wrong".

title: Man Utd 'disgusted' at racial abuse of Tuanzebe and Martial
description: Manchester United say they are "disgusted" after Axel Tuanzebe and Anthony Martial were racially abused on social media by "mindless idiots" after Wednesday's loss to Sheffield United.

title: Spotify wants to suggest songs based on your emotions
description: The streaming giant patents a method of suggesting songs based on a scan of your emotional state.

title: Post-Brexit trading 'difficult' for my business - Samantha Cameron
description: The fashion brand owner tells Woman's Hour she speaks to her former PM husband about her firm's frustrations.

title: 'My parents are my icons' - GB cyclist Backstedt follows in the family footsteps
description: GB cyclist and Generation Next athlete Elynor Backstedt on following in the family footsteps.

title: Scottish independence: Will there be a second referendum?
description: Boris Johnson will visit Scotland on Thursday as polls suggest support for independence has risen.

title: Scottish budget: What do you need to know?
description: The Scottish government is to set out its budget plans against the backdrop of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Double Olympic champion Glover's Tokyo comeback bid inspired by her children
description: Double Olympic champion Helen Glover says proving herself to her baby daughter inspired her attempt a comeback at next summer's Tokyo games.

title: Just four permanent Premier League deals done - is this the most difficult transfer window ever?
description: With only a handful of transfers completed in the Premier League so far in January, are clubs finding it harder than ever to do deals?

title: Deer herd crossing Hertfordshire countryside captured on camera
description: The animals were seen near to Royston, Hertfordshire.

title: Free anthology of black authors to be given to all primary schools in England
description: The initiative will provide a copy of the collection to all primary schools in England.

title: Covid vaccines: Misleading claims targeting ethnic minority people
description: We've been tracking some of the misinformation about vaccines that has circulated in minority communities.

title: Joe Biden's tech - what can the president use?
description: From the ObamaPad to Joe Biden's Apple Watch and Peloton, being president can be a tech challenge.

title: Sani Abacha - the hunt for the billions stolen by Nigeria's ex-leader
description: A phone call in the middle of the night led one Swiss lawyer to pursue Nigeria's stolen money.

title: Parosmia: 'Since I had Covid, food makes me want to vomit'
description: Many are finding things do not smell right after Covid - and that most foods smell and taste disgusting.

title: The pilots forced to change career completely
description: With airlines grounded due to Covid, we speak to three former pilots who have left the industry.

title: Fyodor Cherenkov: The Soviet football genius the world never got to see
description: Fyodor Cherenkov was an outstanding talent, a football hero in the Soviet Union. He also suffered terribly with mental illness.

title: UK holiday boom: Bookings 'coming in thick and fast'
description: With new hotel quarantine rules for arrivals from abroad, many people are seeking UK holidays instead.

title: MOTD Analysis: Calamity of errors’ costs Man Utd in Blades defeat
description: Match of the Day's Gary Lineker, Dion Dublin and Martin Keown discuss the defensive errors that led to Manchester United's 2-1 defeat against Sheffield United at Old Trafford.

title: Chinese New Year: Clamping down on going home for the holidays
description: China is striving to curtail the world's biggest mass migration event when people go home to see family.

title: Kristal and her students are fighting to eradicate ocean plastic
description: Kristal Ambrose set up the Bahamas Plastic Movement in 2013 in a bid to reduce pollution.

title: Covid: Living through lockdown in a high-rise flat
description: The continuing lockdown in England is tough for everyone but what's it like if you have limited space at home?

title: Covid-19: 'I told my kids I wasn't going to make it'
description: Taxi driver Ali Sakallioglu spent 222 days in hospital with Covid, including three months in a coma.

title: English National Opera lessons for long Covid sufferers
description: The English National Opera's singing coach gives long Covid sufferers breathing space.
